intro: Koeleria kulikovii, commonly known as the Kulikov's needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, pale blue to purple flowers. Koeleria kulikovii typically thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations.
